title: Transfer deadline day live updates : Manchester United explore Marcel Sabitzer loan , Enzo Fernandez latest and more
body_text:
Full recap of all January transfer deadline day deals and news
Summary
Hello and welcome to The Athletic's live blog for transfer deadline day.
The window has now closed for the Premier League, the EFL, and La Liga. You can see all the key timings for other major leagues here in our deadline day guide.
Follow here for all the latest transfer deadline day news from across the globe!
Major headlines:
- Chelsea reach agreement in principle for Enzo Fernandez
- Hakim Ziyech loan move to PSG from Chelsea on verge of collapse due to paperwork issue
- Arsenal sign Jorginho from Chelsea
- Manchester United finalise loan move for Bayern Munich’s Marcel Sabitzer
- Every Premier League deal in the January transfer window
(Photo: Getty Images)
Recapping today's headlines
Transfer deadline day saw all sorts of money and deals flying around England and Europe! Here are some of the biggest storylines from the day:
- Chelsea reach agreement in principle for Enzo Fernandez, but have yet to announce deal
- Hakim Ziyech loan move to PSG from Chelsea breaks down due to paperwork issue
- Arsenal sign Jorginho from Chelsea
- Manchester United sign Bayern Munich’s Marcel Sabitzer on loan
You can also see our list of every Premier League deal made during the past month here.
Stoke confirm Tuanzebe loan signing
Axel Tuanzebe has officially joined Stoke City from Manchester United on loan for the rest of the season.
The 25-year-old defender provides depth at Stoke following the departure of Harry Souttar to Leicester City.
Tuanzebe has yet to make an appearance this season due to a long-term injury but returned to training last week.
Looking ahead to the summer window
The January transfer window may have only just closed but the world of transfers never stops.
So, naturally, The Athletic is already looking ahead to the summer.
That is the next time clubs in Europe’s major leagues will be able to strengthen their squads. The landscape is likely to look very different — trophies, European places and relegation will all be decided by the time the summer window opens.
But when exactly will clubs be able to do business again and which deals are worth looking out for?
We are on hand to take you through all the important details.
Fulham secure Cedric loan after signing Duffy on permanent deal
Fulham have confirmed the signing of Cedric Soares from Arsenal on loan until the end of the season.
The 31-year-old right back signs after centre back Shane Duffy turned his loan move from Brighton & Hove Albion into a permanent transfer.
Premier League rules required that Fulham turn one of their existing two Premier League loans into a permanent agreement before they could make another loan signing.
Leeds winger Dan James is also at the club but Duffy had six months remaining on his contract at Brighton, and Fulham have turned the remaining months of his stay into a permanent deal.
Head coach Marco Silva had been eager to sign a right-back before the deadline to provide competition for Kenny Tete. He has worked with Cedric before during his season at Sporting Lisbon, in 2014-15.
Paul Onuachu joins Southampton in £18.6m transfer
Southampton have announced the signing of Paul Onuachu from Genk in a deal worth €21million (£18.6m).
The club had an offer rejected last week, but the player outlined his desire to play in the Premier League.
On Friday afternoon, Southampton made an improved offer which forced Genk’s hand.
Onuachu, who joined Genk from FC Midtjylland in 2019, has been in fine form for Genk in the Jupiler Pro League this season.
The 6ft 6in striker has scored 17 goals in 22 games in all competitions and leads the Belgian league in scoring.
Southampton complete Kamaldeen Sulemana signing
Southampton have completed the signing of Kamaldeen Sulemana from Stade Rennes on a four-and a-half year deal worth an initial €25million.
Sulemana provides the desired versatility to Southampton frontline, having completed his medical in France on earlier today.
The 20-year-old ultimately chose Southampton ahead of Everton, who made a verbal offer for him on Sunday, with the club tracking the forward since his time FC Nordsjaelland.
Southampton will pay a further €3m in add-ons providing certain clauses are met.
Manchester United sign Marcel Sabitzer
Manchester United have announced the signing of midfielder Marcel Sabitzer, 28, from Bayern Munich on loan for the rest of the season.
The Austria international has made 54 appearances for Bayern since joining the German side in August 2021.
United were in need of midfield depth after Christian Eriksen suffered a long-term ankle injury in Saturday's FA Cup match against Reading.
Albrighton joins West Brom on loan
Leicester City winger Marc Albrighton has joined West Bromwich Albion on loan until the end of the season.
West Brom tried to sign Omari Hutchinson on loan as well but were unable to get the deal over the line in time.
Albrighton, 33, made just six Premier League appearances for Leicester this season, scoring one goal.
Ziyech loan move to PSG on verge of collapse due to paperwork issue
Hakim Ziyech’s loan move from Chelsea to Paris Saint-Germain appears to have collapsed in dramatic circumstances because the Premier League club failed to file the necessary paperwork ahead of the transfer deadline.
Ziyech, 29, arrived in Paris on Tuesday to complete the move.
The Morocco international had earlier agreed to join the reigning French champions on loan for the remainder of the season.
But Chelsea are accused of failing to submit the paperwork in time for the move to be processed, leaving Ziyech in Paris but unable to sign for PSG.
A PSG source, who wished not to be named to protect their relationships at the club, described the situation as a “Class A circus”.
Chelsea have been contacted for comment.
PSG are considering an appeal.
(Photo: Getty Images)
Brighton loan two youngsters
Brighton have loaned out two more of their under-21s.
Left-back James Furlong has joined Motherwell in the Scottish Premier League for the rest of the season.
Midfielder Jack Spong links up with League Two side Crawley Town on the same basis.
Jordan Smith joins Huddersfield from Nottingham Forest
Goalkeeper Jordan Smith will depart Nottingham Forest following the signing of Keylor Navas on loan from Paris Saint-Germain.
The 28-year-old, who is out of contract in the summer, is joining Huddersfield Town.
Smith made the bulk of his appearances for Forest during the 2016-17 and 2017-18 seasons, helping the club avoid relegation to League One.
Nottingham Forest announce Navas signing
Nottingham Forest have announced the signing of Keylor Navas from Paris Saint-Germain.
The goalkeeper has signed on loan for the remainder of the season.
Navas, 36, brings tremendous experience to Forest, who are fighting to avoid relegation.
The Costa Rican international previously won three Champions League titles with Real Madrid, being named the UEFA Champions League Goalkeeper of the Season in 2017-18.
Aston Villa loans young defender to Bristol Rovers
Lamare Bogarde has signed for Bristol Rovers on loan from Aston Villa.
The 19-year-old defender, who can also play in central midfield, moves out on loan for the first time following his arrival from Feyenoord in 2020.
Nottingham Forest confirm Shelvey signing, Navas to follow
Nottingham Forest have completed the signing of midfielder Jonjo Shelvey from Newcastle.
The 30-year-old has signed a contract with the club that will run until the summer of 2025 and will wear the number 6 shirt at the City Ground.
He is the second signing of deadline day, with Felipe having already joined from Atletico Madrid - while Keylor Navas will become the third new addition.
The PSG keeper has agreed terms and completed a medical in France and will officially join once the final paperwork is completed - which Forest expect to be a formality.
The 36-year-old former Real Madrid player could make his debut at Leeds on Sunday.
Shelvey was keen on the move as he believes it will give him the chance of more regular first team football, having found himself down the pecking order in the north-east - although his opportunities have more recently been limited by a minor injury.
Shelvey was persuaded to sign for Forest not only by some positive words from Steve Cooper, but also from Newcastle boss Eddie Howe.
“I spoke to Eddie Howe and he had such good words to say about Steve Cooper. I previously knew of him from my time at Liverpool, so I knew what a fantastic coach he was, but meeting him for the first time has been a breath of fresh air,” said Shelvey.
The window has now closed!
The transfer window has officially closed for the Premier League, the EFL, and La Liga!
Teams that submitted a deal sheet in the past two hours have the next two hours to complete paperwork.
And we may yet still learn of some news that hasn't publicly broken yet...
Tottenham sign Pedro Porro from Sporting Lisbon
Tottenham Hotspur have completed the signing of Pedro Porro from Sporting Lisbon for €45million (£40m).
Porro has been replaced at Sporting by Barcelona right-back Hector Bellerin.
Tottenham, meanwhile, mutually terminated the contract of Matt Doherty to facilitate Porro’s arrival.
Tuanzebe undergoing Stoke medical
Axel Tuanzebe is undergoing a medical at Stoke City, providing cover in defence after Harry Souttar was transferred to Leicester City.
The Manchester United defender has yet to make an appearance this season due to a long-term injury but returned to first team training at Carrington last week.
The 25-year-old spent the first half of last season on loan at Aston Villa, then joined Napoli on a six-month deal after his stay at Villa Park was cut short.
Danel Sinani completes Wigan move
Norwich City winger Danel Sinani has completed his loan move to fellow Championship side Wigan Athletic.
The 25-year-old has made 16 league appearances this season, scoring one goal. He is out of contract this summer.
Sporting announce Bellerin signing
Sporting Lisbon have officially signed Barcelona right-back Hector Bellerin for the rest of the season.
The 27-year-old’s arrival gives Sporting a replacement for Pedro Porro, who Tottenham Hotspur are hoping to sign before the deadline.
The Spain international has been restricted to only seven appearances this season — with just three of those coming in La Liga.
